intro: Hieracium jaculifolium, commonly known as the spear-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow, arranged in a cluster, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium jaculifolium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can be invasive in some regions.
